messages: 3fe145094f808469bffe4e30453f94c1 (15:59): needs to step out for a bit, but will check back later before going on holidays.
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (16:13): MarcoZ_afk: darn was just going to ask you something
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (16:14): MarcoZ_afk: I private messaged you a link to try out. It isn't a live web page yet.

8b61c11eb8baedd53d2e99d1a01fa7bb (16:34): davidb:  if you have time for a riddle, what is this in terms of the a11y tree:  <label for="shuffle" role="button" aria-pressed="false">  (btw, I cheated, and look with accerciser).
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (16:36): 8b61c11eb8baedd53d2e99d1a01fa7bb: i'd have to look at the tree or at our code to answer
8b61c11eb8baedd53d2e99d1a01fa7bb (16:37): davidb:  you are confessing to not being an aria processor?  ;-)
8b61c11eb8baedd53d2e99d1a01fa7bb (16:37): what's your intuition?

8b61c11eb8baedd53d2e99d1a01fa7bb (16:40): okay, accerciser tells me it's a push button.  so not a label, but not a toggle either.  My intuition said it should be a toggle given it has an aria-pressed attribute.
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (16:43): did you see that in the wild?
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (16:43): is there an element with id 'shuffle'?
8b61c11eb8baedd53d2e99d1a01fa7bb (16:46): davidb:  not precisely "the wild".  and yes there is an element with id shuffle:  <input id="shuffle" type="checkbox">
8b61c11eb8baedd53d2e99d1a01fa7bb (16:46): it's a proposal for buttons for jQueryUI (not my proposal).
8b61c11eb8baedd53d2e99d1a01fa7bb (16:47): btw, that input#shuffle also shows up in the a11y tree, as a checkbox (no surprise there) with the label coming from the above <label>.
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (16:48): 8b61c11eb8baedd53d2e99d1a01fa7bb: in case i don't get a chance to say it later, "Happy Holidays to you and your family!"
8b61c11eb8baedd53d2e99d1a01fa7bb (16:48): so, FF is clever in that even though it recognizes the <label> as a button, it still uses it to correctly label the checkbox.
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (16:48): FF is a cunning fox
8b61c11eb8baedd53d2e99d1a01fa7bb (16:48): davidb:  thanks!  And a Merry Christmas/Happy New Year to you and yours!
8b61c11eb8baedd53d2e99d1a01fa7bb (16:49): yes, FF is impressive, but why is it not properly representing the "button" as a toggle?  Or is that an atk/atspi issue?
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (16:50): could be
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (16:50): checks list of atk roles
8b61c11eb8baedd53d2e99d1a01fa7bb (16:50): davidb:  just got confirmation from mgorse that atk and atspi have a toggle role.
8b61c11eb8baedd53d2e99d1a01fa7bb (16:51): tbsaunde:  ^
8b61c11eb8baedd53d2e99d1a01fa7bb (16:51): they are ATK_ROLE_TOGGLE_BUTTON / ATSPI_ROLE_TOGGLE_BUTTON
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (16:51): 8b61c11eb8baedd53d2e99d1a01fa7bb: yeah, just that myself :0
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (16:52): *saw :)
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (16:53): 8b61c11eb8baedd53d2e99d1a01fa7bb: why wouldn't you expect it to be a push button?
8b61c11eb8baedd53d2e99d1a01fa7bb (16:54): tbsaunde:  because it has an aria-pressed attribute.  that's how one tells the browser that the button is a toggle.
8b61c11eb8baedd53d2e99d1a01fa7bb (16:56): wishes aria had a toggle button role.

94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (16:56): 8b61c11eb8baedd53d2e99d1a01fa7bb: ok, I've never investigated the various types of buttons but at first glance it's not clear to me the differences between them

8b61c11eb8baedd53d2e99d1a01fa7bb (16:58): tbsaunde:  a toggle is like the play button on a cd player.  It has two state:  pressed and released.  When pressed, the cd plays.  When not pressed, the cd pauses.  Another example is a "Bold" tool bar button.  When pressed, you get bolded text.  When not pressed, you get plain text.
8b61c11eb8baedd53d2e99d1a01fa7bb (16:58): a push button (like an OK button) just activates something ‚Äî it doesn't' stay pressed.
47e87577fff6e08b0f2f43540db8c9c9 (16:59): <email/> requested review from <email/>  for attachment 583798 on bug 249735.
47e87577fff6e08b0f2f43540db8c9c9 (16:59): <email/> changed the Status on bug 249735 from NEW to ASSIGNED.

47e87577fff6e08b0f2f43540db8c9c9 (16:59): Bug https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=249735 nor, P1, ---, dao, ASSI, F6 goes to the first focusable element instead of the address bar (does not focus on location bar)
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (17:01): 8b61c11eb8baedd53d2e99d1a01fa7bb: oh, ok thanks
8b61c11eb8baedd53d2e99d1a01fa7bb (17:01): tbsaunde:  wlcm.
34171b8ea3c68516dffe90f90a3c5de7 (17:06): davidb: I fixed the popup to use role=tooltip instead of alert
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (17:06): ok i'll try it!
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (17:10): 8b61c11eb8baedd53d2e99d1a01fa7bb: so, I just took a look at what we do and I'd think we should call your label a toggle button
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (17:10): and I'm not really sure why we don't
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (17:10): 34171b8ea3c68516dffe90f90a3c5de7: can you put role="presentation" on the ui-tooltip-* elements (the ones with a canvas child)?
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (17:14): 8b61c11eb8baedd53d2e99d1a01fa7bb: why do the jquery people want to do this in the first place?
8b61c11eb8baedd53d2e99d1a01fa7bb (17:14): tbsaunde:  thanks.  does this cover window version too?  I haven't checked what happens with msaa/ia2 yet.
8b61c11eb8baedd53d2e99d1a01fa7bb (17:14): tbsaunde:  you'd have to ask them :-)
8b61c11eb8baedd53d2e99d1a01fa7bb (17:14): although I can come up with a partial answer.

8b61c11eb8baedd53d2e99d1a01fa7bb (17:15): it might be to maintain some form of two-stated-ness when dealing with a non-aria browser.  In that case aria is ignored, and the thing devolves into a labelled checkbox.
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (17:16): 8b61c11eb8baedd53d2e99d1a01fa7bb: windows right?
8b61c11eb8baedd53d2e99d1a01fa7bb (17:16): notes that not all browsers are as good at aria as FF is.
8b61c11eb8baedd53d2e99d1a01fa7bb (17:16): tbsaunde:  not sure what you are asking re:  windows right?
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (17:16): 8b61c11eb8baedd53d2e99d1a01fa7bb: if we call it a push button on linux I'd be 99.99% sure we don't call it a toggle button on windows
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (17:17): 8b61c11eb8baedd53d2e99d1a01fa7bb: you said does this cover window
8b61c11eb8baedd53d2e99d1a01fa7bb (17:17): tbsaunde:  right, now I get yeah,  Yes, I wanted to know that if you fixed it, it would be fixed for both windows and linux.
8b61c11eb8baedd53d2e99d1a01fa7bb (17:17): it sounds like it would.
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (17:17): yeah, really should be
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (17:18): but various horrible things have been known to happen that mean things break ;)
8b61c11eb8baedd53d2e99d1a01fa7bb (17:18): no, really?
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (17:20): never with roles in particular, but yes
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (17:23): that reminds me, 81fa1e07c4ea96f215901d989f8bf37b  can we get c preproccessored stuff into idl somehow? eis idl cpp'd or can you include headers?
81fa1e07c4ea96f215901d989f8bf37b (17:25): I'm afraid to ask why you want to do that
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (17:25): 81fa1e07c4ea96f215901d989f8bf37b: expandos
81fa1e07c4ea96f215901d989f8bf37b (17:25): doesn't know what those are
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (17:25): like what we do for atoms
81fa1e07c4ea96f215901d989f8bf37b (17:26): you want to do that for things on the interface?
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (17:26): yeah, constants
81fa1e07c4ea96f215901d989f8bf37b (17:26): do they need to be reflected into js?
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (17:26): yes
81fa1e07c4ea96f215901d989f8bf37b (17:26): yeah we don't have that ability
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (17:27): how do we do it for event types?
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (17:27): do we just have multiple lists? and when you make a change you better remember all of the places to change?
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (17:30): yeah, or just look ;)
81fa1e07c4ea96f215901d989f8bf37b (17:30): that works too
